Certificate.title: Certificate + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models

ContactLineSystem.title: ContactLineSystem + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
ContactLineSystem.description: System that is used to transmit electrical energy to road or rail vehicles.

ETCSLevel.title: ETCSLevel + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
ETCSLevel.description: ERTMS / ETCS application level related to the track side equipment.

Feature.title: Feature + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
Feature.description: Class that encompasses the features that are part of the physical infrastructure (class InfrastructureObject) and the topological objects (class TopologicalObject). It is a subclass of the geographical Feature class that has a spatial representation.

FrenchTrainDetectionSystemLimitation.title: FrenchTrainDetectionSystemLimitation + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
FrenchTrainDetectionSystemLimitation.description:
Specific for route compatibility check on French network. Sections with: 
-1 Tonnage circulated per track is inferior to 15000 tons/day/track 
-2 Directional Interlocking 
-3 45-second delay for directional interlocking 
-4 Installation with track circuit announcement 
-5 Absence of a shunting assistance pedal in the normal direction of circulation for non-reversible double track lines 
-6 Absence of a shunting assistance pedal regardless of the direction of traffic for single track lines and tracks for two way working 
-7 Absence of a pedal announcement mechanism 
-8 45-second delay for specific announcement reset devices

InfrastructureManager.title: InfrastructureManager + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
InfrastructureManager.description: The infrastructure manager owns and operates the railway network and related infrastructure.

InfrastructureObject.title: InfrastructureObject + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
InfrastructureObject.description:
This class encompasses all those classes that represent features that are  implemented in the European railway infrastructure. It is a subclass of the ERA Feature that has a spatial representation. It covers tracks, platforms, signals, tunnels, operational points, and sections of line.
A feature that belongs to the infrastructure can be abstracted (hasAbstraction) as a topological object. It also is related to the infrastructure manager through the property infrastructureMgr.

LineReference.title: LineReference + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models

LoadCapability.title: LoadCapability + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
LoadCapability.description: This class together with properties loadCapabilityLineCategory and loadCapabilitySpeed replaces the previous loadCapability SKOS property.

Manufacturer.title: Manufacturer + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
Manufacturer.description: A company or organization that manufactures vehicles.

MaximumMagneticField.title: MaximumMagneticField + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
MaximumMagneticField.description:
The maximum magnetic field limits allowed for axle counters (in dBµA/m) for a defined frequency band.
It should be provided in 3 directions.

MaximumSpeedAndCantDeficiency.title: MaximumSpeedAndCantDeficiency + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
MaximumSpeedAndCantDeficiency.description: Combination of maximum speed and maximum cant deficiency for which the vehicle was assessed.

MinAxleLoadVehicleCategory.title: MinAxleLoadVehicleCategory + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
MinAxleLoadVehicleCategory.description: Deprecated according to the ammendment to the Regulation (EU) 2019/777. Represents information that indicates the load given in tons depending of the category of vehicle. Its properties are minAxleLoadVehicleCategory and minAxleLoad.

NationalRailwayLine.title: NationalRailwayLine + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
NationalRailwayLine.description: Railway line within a member state.

NetElement.title: NetElement + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
NetElement.description: Base class for defining nodes in the connectivity graph representing the topological network.

NetRelation.title: NetRelation + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
NetRelation.description: Base class for defining edges in the connectivity graph representing the topological network.

OperationalPoint.title: OperationalPoint + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
OperationalPoint.description:
An operational point (OP) means any location for train service operations, where train services may begin and end or change route, and where passenger or freight services may be provided; operational point also means any location at boundaries between Member States or infrastructure managers.
In https://eur-lex.europa.eu/eli/reg_impl/2019/773/oj 2.1.2 Principal locations (stations, yards, junctions, freight terminals).

PhaseInfo.title: PhaseInfo + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
PhaseInfo.description: Indication of required several information on phase separation.

Platform.title: Platform + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
Platform.description: Platform for the purpose of RINF is understood as a platform edge. A platform concerns only the part of the structure neighbouring to the track (interfaced with trains).

RaisedPantographsDistanceAndSpeed.title: RaisedPantographsDistanceAndSpeed + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
RaisedPantographsDistanceAndSpeed.description:
Indication of maximum number of raised pantographs per train allowed and minimum spacing centre line to centre line of adjacent pantograph heads, expressed in metres, at the given speed.
Each track can have several raised pantographs per train allowed (structured) values, and each one has values for number of pantographs, minimum distance between pantographs, in metres, and speed considered in km/h.

SectionOfLine.title: SectionOfLine + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
SectionOfLine.description:
A section of line means the part of line between adjacent operational points and may consist of several tracks.
In https://eur-lex.europa.eu/eli/reg_impl/2019/773/oj 2.1.1 Line sections.

Siding.title: Siding + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
Siding.description: Sidings are all those tracks where running trains in service movements ends and which are not used for operational routing of a train.

Signal.title: Signal + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
Signal.description:
A railway signal is an installation next to the railway track for signalling the maximum allowed speed in the next block section to the train driver.
Definition RSM: Apparatus by means of which a conventional visual or acoustic indication is given, generally concerning the movements of railway vehicles.

SpecialArea.title: SpecialArea + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
SpecialArea.description: Encompasses all those areas or sections such as safe areas, restricted areas (non-stopping areas or industrial risk locations).

SpecialTunnelArea.title: SpecialTunnelArea + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
SpecialTunnelArea.description: Area or location within a tunnel where  there is a walkway, evacuation and rescue points.

SubsetWithCommonCharacteristics.title: SubsetWithCommonCharacteristics + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
SubsetWithCommonCharacteristics.description: Subset of items shared by sections of lines and/or operational points of a member state. For the purposes of the register of infrastructure, each infrastructure manager shall describe its railway network at least by sections of line and operational points and optionally via common characteristic subsets.

SystemSeparationInfo.title: SystemSeparationInfo + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
SystemSeparationInfo.description: Indication of required several information on system separation.

TopologicalObject.title: TopologicalObject + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
TopologicalObject.description: Top level class for the the track network described as a topological node edge model

Track.title: Track + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
Track.description: A running track that is used for train service movements.

TrainDetectionSystem.title: TrainDetectionSystem + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
TrainDetectionSystem.description: System used to detect the position of vehicles in the railway track.

Tunnel.title: Tunnel + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
Tunnel.description: A railway tunnel is an excavation or a construction around the track provided to allow the railway to pass for example higher land, buildings or water.

Vehicle.title: Vehicle + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
Vehicle.description: A specific vehicle or wagon able to operate over railway lines.

VehicleKeeper.title: VehicleKeeper + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
VehicleKeeper.description: A company or organization that owns or operates a certain vehicle.

VehicleType.title: VehicleType + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
VehicleType.description: A vehicle type that has been authorized to operate on the EU railway infrastructure.

wgs84_pos#Point.title: wgs84_pos#Point + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
wgs84_pos#Point.description: A point, typically described using a coordinate system relative to Earth, such as WGS84.

wgs84_pos#SpatialThing.title: wgs84_pos#SpatialThing + mapped from ERA ontology by Smart Data Models
wgs84_pos#SpatialThing.description:
Anything with spatial extent, i.e. size, shape, or position.
 e.g. people, places, bowling balls, as well as abstract areas like cubes.
